summary: This document appears to be notes from a December 1, 2021 meeting with Dr. Rocchio, prepared for trial testimony. It discusses Dr. Rocchio's background, lack of payment for work at Brown University, and statistics on grooming behaviors in patients reporting childhood sexual abuse.

persons.name: Dr. Rocchio
persons.context: Met with on December 1, 2021 to prepare for trial testimony; works at Brown University without pay, meeting minimum hours requirement; has not read articles about trial testimony substance.

events.title: Meeting with Dr. Rocchio for trial preparation
events.description: Meeting held to prepare Dr. Rocchio for trial testimony, discussing background, work at Brown University, and statistics on grooming behaviors in patients reporting childhood sexual abuse.

keyFacts: Dr. Rocchio does not get paid for work at Brown University and must work a minimum of 100 hours per year.
Dr. Rocchio had not read articles about the substance of testimony at trial as of the meeting date.
Majority of patients Dr. Rocchio has treated who reported childhood sexual abuse reported behaviors consistent with grooming, with literature citing rates between 35-50%.
